results.name: a(n) = -1 if the closest prime to prime(n) is prime(n-1); = 1 if the closest prime to prime(n) is prime(n+1); = 0 if prime(n-1) and prime(n+1) are equally close to prime(n).
comment: There is no gap before 2, so we start with prime 3.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..20000
Pe, J. L. Prime Gap Tug of War
C. Rivera, Puzzle 271: Prime gap tug of war.
formula: a(n) = min(1, max(-1, A001223(n-1) - A001223(n))). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 16 2012
example: prime(1) = 2 is closer to prime(2) = 3 than prime(3) = 5, so a(2) = -1.

elif q-p=r-q then a:=[op(a),0]; else a:=[op(a),1]; fi;
